column1: full, fast, swinging in at yorker length, clears the front leg and jams it into the off side
goes for the yorker at leg stump, no movement this time and this goes down the leg
slight movement away, and another yorker. This one is in the corridor, and he digs it out to mid-off
overpitched, swinging in at off stump, driven firmly to mid-on
in the blockhole outside off, slices this to Bumrah at third man who fumbles, but won't pay a price for it
looks for the slower ball yorker, misses his line again, down the leg side and through to Parthiv
misses the length this time. Slower ball, floated full outside off, puts in a big stride and clubs it through his partner's legs and past mid-on
a yorker at middle stump, clears the front leg and gets it sweetly off the middle as he slices this to cover
back of a length, angled across off stump, left alone
short and down the leg side, he's backing away, but has enough time to pull this past short fine leg
loud appeal in excitement of beating the batsman. Good length, pitching outside leg and goes straight through and under his attempted slog. Well away from the bat but bowler and keeper appeal
slower bouncer, angled across off stump, drags it to deep midwicket with a pull shot
good length, at off stump, back foot defence into the point region
good length outside off stump, clears the front leg and slaps this through cover point
yorker, just outside off stump, beats him as he tries to chop this square on the off side
another yorker outside off stump, this is a slower ball. He gets bat, but can only dig it out along the pitch and back to the bowler
good length, angled in at off stump, goes for the big heave and gets a thick inside edge to short fine leg. Overstepped, so Gambhir has a free hit next ball
yorker at off stump, he's deep in his crease and gets an extra inch to whip that to Buttler's right at deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, heaves across the line, bat turns and the ball rolls to long leg

another no-ball, this one for height. Misses the yorker by a huge margin this time. It's at off stump, above waist height and just fast enough for him not to wallop that out of the stadium. It lands harmlessly in the off side infield but a free hit for Gambhir again
backs away, expects the yorker again, is rewarded with a low full toss outside off that he slices past a diving point fielder
length ball in the corridor, pokes at this to try and dab a single through third man, gets an outside edge that beats him instead
and changes length. Good length, slower ball at off stump. Lynn is through the slog early, gets it off the bottom to square leg who has a shy and misses at the non-striker's
good length, swinging in at middle stump, watches it closely and taps it late to short fine leg
slower ball, short and wide, bludgeoned straight to cover point on the up
he likes this length. Just short of a good length, slower ball that he's expecting. Stands tall, waits for it and slaps it 91 metres into the stands at the square leg boundary
back of a length at middle stump, mistimed pull to deep midwicket
good length at off stump, dabs it late to third man off the back foot
good length at leg stump, backs way but cramped, pushes to square leg
good length at leg stump, this time he stays put, gets on one knee and tries to lift this over square leg with a sweep. McCleneghan times his jump nicely and holds on to it
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length, arm ball at off stump. Uthappa offers an angled bat as he pokes at this off the front foot. Thick outside edge runs away to the third man boundary

and he's gotta go back! Good length at off stump, he doesn't poke at this because slip has come in. Goes for the slog sweep instead. Not to the pitch of this, slices it at a nice height for Hardik at deep midwicket and the Pandya household can't be prouder
back of a length outside off, chopped straight to point
back of a length, angled in at the legs and catches the thigh guard, through to short fine as he misses out on the glance
back of a length, outside off stump, enough room for him to butcher this on the up past extra cover
slower ball, back of a length at middle stump, stands tall and tucks it to deep midwicket
back of a length in the corridor, opens the face and slices it on the up, Rana takes it above his head at point on the bounce, one-handed
good length at leg stump, tucked off his pads to short fine's right
attempted bouncer, but this one sits in the pitch and flies wide, feebly, past the wide marker
good length, slower ball, this time down the leg side

overpitched at leg stump, clears the front leg and hammers this flat past the bowler, it bounces once and is headed to the boundary but a wild Pollard appears out of nowhere - diving low to the left at long-on, one-handed, takes it on the bounce - and that's only two
full at off stump, opens his stance and pushes it to sweeper cover
good length at leg stump, driven to long-on off the back foot
good length at off stump, pushed to cover on the up
good length at off stump, pushes it wide of cover this time and he slides poorly - above the ball - and allows a second
full at leg stump, driven to long-on
full at leg stump, flicked straight to short fine
slower ball at a length outside off, flat-batted on the up to extra cover
slower length ball at off again, this time he flat-bats it past the bowler and picks up two as long-on and long-off converge

plumb in front. Good length, this one is fast and straight. Lynn shuffles across and tries to lift this square on the leg side. It's an ugly swipe in the end, with eyes off the ball. It strikes him just above the flap on the back leg which is in front of middle stump. Correction: It hit the knee roll on the front leg
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
good length outside off stump, tapped into the off side
full at off stump, defended solidly off the front foot, straight to mid-off
good length at off stump, tucked off the back foot, straight to midwicket
back of a length at middle stump, back foot drive to deep square
good length at off stump, forward defence back down the pitch
good length at off stump, one hands comes off the bat as he sweeps this to deep square leg's right, but that's Krunal there and he runs hard and puts in a dive at the boundary line
back of a length at off stump, chopped to deep point
good length at off stump, punched off the back foot to midwicket's right
back of a length outside off, waits late and cuts it past point who gets a hand to slow it down as sweeper approaches it
tossed up outside off, steps out, gets to the pitch but only after stretching wide. Can only hit it to long-off
good length outside off, one-handed sweep again, this time long leg is in place and he finds him
tossed up at middle stump, steps out and jams it out to long-on
good length at off stump, goes forward and drops it into the off side
short at middle stump, straightens and forces him to swivel as he pulls it to deep square
good length outside off, arm ball, slides through quickly under his attempted cut and beats him

good length at off stump, closes the face too early and the leading edge teases extra cover and the bowler, before landing safely in front of both. Buttler then attempts a run-out but Pandey has dived back in and he's safe, as third umpire confirms
short and wide, finds sweeper with the cut
short and wide outside off stump, back foot punch to find sweeper
flat full toss at off stump, clears the front leg, slogs it past Rohit at midwicket who might have got a hand on it, long-on doesn't have to travel too fast to his right
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler

dropped. This is looped beautifully at middle stump, draws him forward, makes him poke, draws the edge. Basically he's done everything perfectly as a left-arm spinner. But that took off rapidly and Parthiv can't hold on
full and wide outside off, this time he throws his hands at it unceremoniously, gets an outside edge again, and it's four this time
back of a length at off stump, back foot punch to sweeper

beautiful bowling. Loops it up again, good length at off. Pathan has had enough scratching around. Bounces down the track, doesn't get to the pitch and slices this to long-off's left, and it's brother Hardik under it again
back of a length outside off, finds point with the cut
back of a length at off stump, goes deep in the crease and whips it to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length, fired in at leg stump, pushed to long leg
top spinner, short and wide, hangs back and opens the face to get this past short third man. Skillful.
fires it fast, short at off stump, pulls it to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot past the bowler
flat and short at off stump again, hurries him on the pull, he can't connect, rolls slowly to midwicket
short and wide outside off, late cut, can't get it past short third man
full at leg stump, driven with the full face to long-on
short and wide outside off stump, backs away and slaps it to sweeper cover
short at middle stump, skips outside leg stump to ramp it to the third man boundary, beaten
slower ball at off stump, good length, hits it on the up and on the bounce to Pollard at long-on
short and wide outside off stump, climbs over his attemped cut shot and beats him
keeps at that line and length, short and wide outside off, this time Pandey doesn't try to hit it hard. Anticipates the bounce, and uses it to ramp it over third man
back of a length at off stump, punched straight to extra cover off the back foot
what a shot. Flat at a length outside off, it's like he's playing a pacer against the new ball - half a stride and drives it on the up to beat long-off to his left
top spinner, good length at off stump, pushed back down the pitch
fired flat at leg stump, good length, pushes it past the bowler's right. He gets across but loses the ball as he falls down and they can take a single
good length outside off, dabbed to short third man
superb from Yadav. Flat at a good length outside off, barely moves his feet for this. Exposes the stumps and chops it past short third man
full at off stump, drags this past square leg off the inside half of the bat
slower ball, back of a length at leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
back of a length slower ball at off stump, backs away and slices it to third man
follows the batsman as he moves down the leg side, back of a length, forces him to push on the up to long-on
misses the yorker marginally, and that's enough for Pandey to clear his front leg and lift it over the long-on boundary
lovely. Good length, angled in at off stump, opens the face and blazes it past point
slower ball, full at leg stump, he wants to whip this wide of long-on but the pace throws him off. He lobs it straight to Pollard, who barely has to move at long-on

Pandey nearly runs himself out next ball. Slower ball at leg stump, good length. He taps it to Harbhajan at midwicket and takes him on. Was nowhere near making the crease at the non-strikers, but Harbhajan misses
slower ball, overpitched at middle stump, shapes to drive this, is forced to push at it at the last moment. Thick inside edge to midwicket
slower ball at middle stump, not in control as he looks to work this into the leg side, but only manages to chip it over the umpire
yorker tailing in at leg stump, squeezed down to long-on
slower length ball at middle stump, pushes it to midwicket's right and keeps the strike
slower ball, full at off stump, catches the inside edge as he swipes across the line. Malinga misfields at short fine to his left, but they'd already run through
he's not picking the slower ball at either end. This one is full at off stump, he's through the drive early, trying to thread it through the off side. Goes off the inside half to deep midwicket
yorker at off stump, tapped into the off side
slower ball, low full toss at off stump. Picks it and absolutely nails the slog. Finds deep midwicket. That's fifty for him

full toss at off stump, opens the face to find the square boundary  on the off side. Short third man does phenomenally to dive to his right to save a four. Then throws unnecessarily to concede an overthrow to deep midwicet. McCleneghan there
yorker at off stump, brings the bat down hard at this. Chops it to short third man again, who takes a crowd-catch and holds on to it this time
slower length at middle stump, gets under it but can't generate power. Finds Pollard as he tries to slot this over long-on on the up
slower ball, good length at off stump, walks into the shot as he whips this wide of long-on on the up
slower ball, good length outside off, slices it uppishly to find sweeper cover
full at leg stump, whips it nicely, wide of deep midwicket who fumbles and allows a second
shooooot. Waits for the slower ball. It arrives at a full length, off stump line. Front foot out of the way and puts deep midwicket on ball retrieving duty
slower ball, short and wide, tapped to short third man
length ball at off stump, sits up nicely for him and he pulls this on the up over deep midwicket. This length has become predictable for Pandey

but it's a full toss next ball and also a no-ball! Oversteps and bowls a knee-height full toss at middle stump for Pandey to dispatch between long-on and deep midwicket while he smiles at the thought of a free hit next ball
low full toss at his legs. He's standing outside leg stump and moves his leg away to let it go past him. Umpire calls wide. Bowler unimpressed. Rightly so.
misses the yorker again. Errs on the shorter side this time, so it's overpitched at middle stump. Pandey is standing deep. Gets under it and launches it flat over the bowler
yorker, full and wide outside off, can't get bat on this. Wanted to pick third man but is beaten
this time he's successfull! Low full toss, wide outside off, opens the face and taps it through the slip region to find the third man boundary
yorker outside off stump, opens the face and runs it to third man
....anti-climax. Yorker at off stump from around the wicket, gets him on the toe in front of off stump and the umpire raises his finger. Even though replays showed he got a big bottom edge on that.
wide-ish length ball to start, and Parthiv plays a good-looking drive, straight to cover point
back of a length in the corridor, a bit of shape away, beats Parthiv's defensive poke. No footwork there
short, a bit of width, Parthiv stabs it away crisply, just opens his bat face and sends it racing away to the right of backward point and leaves third man no chance of cutting it off to his left
big slash and miss. A little fuller, wide again. Parthiv flays at it and the ball shapes away to beat his bat
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man

full, a bit of swing in towards middle stump. It's the lbw ball, but Buttler hasn't planted his front leg firmly, he quickly moves it out of the way and clips the ball away through square leg. Lovely shot
back of a length, the line is slightly wrong, swings past Parthiv's hip down the leg side

shortish, slanting across Parthiv, gives him a tiny bit of room. Flashes hard at it and misses. Thought I heard a tiny click, and Uthappa does a belated half-appeal, but no one else is interested. Big bottom edge, Ultra Edge says.
back of a length, swinging down the leg side again. Parthiv misses the glance, but gets some thigh pad on it down towards fine leg
short, a bit of shape in to cramp Parthiv for room. Tries to cut, ends up chopping it downwards, into the pitch, and it rolls away square on the off side to enable the single
full, wide outswinger. Buttler chases and misses, looking for the cover drive. Signal of wide - a little harsh in my opinion
back of a length, straightens along the off-stump line. Buttler gets back and across to defend into the on side
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed away towards backward point
another play and miss from Parthiv. This one threatened to shape in and then nipped away off the pitch from a good length outside off. Went for the big, flashy cover drive and got nowhere near it
back of a length, this time it's Boult's turn to swing one down the leg side. Both these bowlers seem slightly put off by the right-left combination

ooh,  beaut. Came back in a long way, pitched just back of a length, cramped Buttler, and roared past his inside edge as he chopped hurriedly downwards. Appeal for caught behind, but there was no inside edge, just thigh
back of a length, swings towards middle and leg. Buttler lets it come on and tucks it through backward square leg

length ball swinging away fairly wide of off. Parthiv is early on the cover drive, drags it to mid-off. Throw from Lynn is at the bowler's end with no one backing up and no chance of running Parthiv out. Gives away a needless overthrow
play and miss. Again. Down the track this time, making himself room, ends up a long way from the ball as Boult swings this away from an off stump line. Was looking for the big hit over the covers
super timing to follow up. This one's a little fuller, and Parthiv holds his shape much better than he has been. Just waits and plays a regular on-the-up drive and bisects mid-off and extra-cover
strange innings, this. A couple of beautiful shots, a lot of ugly swipes. This is an ugly swipe through the leg side, off the bottom of the bat, off a back-of-a-length ball on off and middle

down the track, making room. Woakes bowls the wide outswinger, shortening his length a touch. Buttler reaches out for the slap, misses, and for the second time CK Nandan signals a slightly harsh wide off Woakes
another wide. Saw Buttler looking to make room and bowled it on a sixth-stump line. Buttler just leaves it this time
back of a length close to off stump, rides the bounce to punch this away through point
another wild swish and miss. This time he swipes across the line of a back-of-a-length ball angled across into a fourth-stump line
replay of the previous ball. This one was a lot closer to off stump. Parthiv is lucky he wasn't bowled
same shot again, off the same sort of ball. This time he catches the pull with the inside half of his bat and it bounces gently to the left of midwicket
wow. That's a stunning shot. Woakes goes full and at the stumps, and Buttler takes two nimble steps across and scoops it, easy as you like, over the fine leg boundary

oh man, what's happened here? Buttler steps down the track, doesn't quite get close to the pitch of this ball. Looks to hit over mid-off, doesn't really middle it, and spoons it high in the air. Lynn, turning around and chasing from mid-off, puts in a big dive, doesn't quite get to the ball, and ends up injuring himself. The ball comes to a stop six inches from the rope, but the batsmen don't notice and only run two before Yusuf Pathan puts in a spint and throws it back. Maybe they didn't run because they didn't want to take advantage of Lynn's injury. He's gone off the field now. Looks like his left shoulder.
starts his spell with a shortish ball on leg stump, and Parthiv cashes in, pulls it to the right of the deep square leg fielder
whoops, misfield. Parthiv steps away from leg stump to try and make room, and Narine lands a sharp offbreak on a good length, spins it across his bat face and he edges it wide of slip
pitches outside leg again, flicked to short fine leg
looks to make room again, Narine bowls a shortish offbreak and follows him by shifting his line outside leg. Parthiv pokes it gently into the covers

no premeditation this time. Narine fires a length ball at off stump. Stays back and chops towards short third man, Buttler calls for the single. Yusuf hits direct at the striker's end but Buttler is safe
short, wide, Buttler misses out, cuts straight to cover point, who's inside the circle. The ball did bounce a little extra, though, so he had to work a bit more to get on top of the bounce
googly. Parthiv looks to make room to cut, and it cramps him and he bottom-edges into the pitch
another googly, I think. This one is short and down the leg side. A wide, after Parthiv missed swatting it fine
googly again, cramps Parthiv as he tries to cut. Chopped down into the covers for a hurried single
fullish, close to off stump, turns into the right-hander. Buttler stays back and defends
down the track now and he doesn't quite reach the pitch. Swiped away, along the ground, to deep midwicket
big turn. This looked like a pullable long-hop until it turned sharply, away from Parthiv. He drags it to mid-on, just rolls gently to the fielder
back of a length, stock ball that turns in and cramps Buttler for room. Dabs towards point for another quick single
back of a length on the stumps, goes deep in his crease to whip through midwicket
shortish offbreak, looks to cut but can't make enough room. Jams the ball down into the ground near him, bounces up to the bowler
this one turns the other way from a fuller length. Buttler gets forward to push into the covers
this is an offbreak, in the perfect slot for Buttler to smash it away, with the turn, a lot of bat-speed, over long-on
back of a length this time, Buttler makes room to flat-bat this offbreak to the left of long-off
looks to slog this over the leg side from wide outside off, misses. Narine bowled this one much quicker than his previous balls, I think
shortish stock ball pitching outside off, Buttler flat-bats to long-off. The ball seems to be stopping and turning quite a bit

wham. Parthiv middles one after a while. Floated up outside off, and Parthiv gets down low for the slog-sweep over wide long-on. He was hitting against the turn, but it was full enough for that not to matter

given! Parthiv looks to sweep again, stepped across his stumps before doing so, and missed. Length ball, pitched on off stump, and straightened towards middle and off. Looked a fairly straightforward decision
shortish googly, looks to pull, only manages a bottom-edge that runs away to the fine-leg boundary
sweeps this time, from outside off down to deep backward square leg
length ball on middle stump, turning in. Presses forward to defend and gets an inside edge that rolls into the square-leg region
length ball on middle and off, clipped to midwicket
back of a length, sliding down leg. Looks to shuffle across and glance it fine. Only gets a little tickle of pad down to the keeper

low full-toss, a bit of inswing, and Buttler plays across it and misses. Big lbw appeal, and it's given immediately. I wonder if it may have been going down leg. Seemed to strike him in front of leg stump with a fair distance still to travel, with that late swing. Not the greatest decision from Nitin Menon.
full on off stump, nearly in the blockhole, clipped to mid-on
shortish close to off stump, gets on his toes to punch to deep point
lovely delivery, slanting across the left-hander with a bit of outswing. Rana doesn't move his feet, just pushes at it, and the ball beats his outside edge by a fair distance
short, a bit of width. Turns away and Rohit edges his cut into the ground, to the man at slip
cuts again, another dot ball, this time despite the fielder at backward point fumbling a simple stop. Kuldeep the fielder
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
length ball on leg stump, clipped away to deep midwicket

a lot of legbreaks this over, and Narine has foxed Rohit with the offbreak. Goes on the back foot and it hurries into him. Big lbw appeal as he plays all around it, given immediately, but CK Nandan shouldn't have. Huge inside-edge on that - two poor lbw decisions in successive overs.
back of a length, straightens towards off stump. Krunal is stuck on the crease, jams his bat down hurriedly to defend
fullish on off stump, defended with the angle to cover, no real footwork
back of a length on middle and off, punched back to the bowler
full, attacking Rana's feet. He gets his feet out of the way and scoops this in the air, on the bounce, to long-on
short, down the leg side. Big appeal for caught behind after Krunal misses the pull. No wide signal from the umpire - that's because it hit him on the hip on the way through
short again, this one's chest high outside off, enough swinging room to pull that to the midwicket boundary
length ball on leg stump. Seems to stop on Pandya, but he goes through with the flick and just clears the leaping fielder at midwicket
tossed up on off stump, Rana goes for the reverse-sweep, hits it straight to short third man
flighted ball outside off, driven to long-off
shot! back of a length, not too far outside off, lets it come on and uses the pace to dab to the left of the keeper and the right of short third man
flighted and very full outside off, a yorker. Rana tries to force it  away through cover, can't connect
this time he does connect. Some flight again, full and just outside off. In Rana's slot and he slog-sweeps into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
flight again, and this one's wider outside off, Rana gets a big stride forward and just launches that over extra-cover. Effortlessly done
back of a length down the leg side. Krunal looks to shuffle across and work it fine, only manages a thin edge through to the keeper
big lbw appeal first ball. Not given. Looks like he got the ball to tail in again. Pollard played across his front pad and missed. Height seemed to be the issue there
back of a length on off stump, clipped away to the left of long leg

short outside off, and Pollard will feast on these chest-high offerings. Swivels and pulls hard and flat over the midwicket boundary. Super shot. Short balls need to get up around shoulder or head high to test Pollard
slower ball, full outside off, jabbed to point
full outside off, nearly in the blockhole, again a bit of shape in. Pollard looks to stay next to the line of the ball and slice behind point with an open face, but can't put bat to ball
flighted ball outside off, swept hard to deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, punched firmly back to the bowler
Googly, Pollard didn't seem to pick it. Read it off the pitch and defended from the crease, with soft hands

pitches the googly fuller and wider, looking to induce the edge to slip. Pokes hesitantly into the point region, sets off, and is slow to turn, but makes it back safely enough. Throw to the keeper is wide, on the bounce, and Uthappa doesn't collect cleanly
another googly, but this was short, and he goes back to whip to deep midwicket, who misfields to allow a second
stock ball this time, turning in towards middle stump. Pollard plays from the crease, defends it. Didn't seem to read it out of the hand again
length ball on middle and leg, clipped away through midwicket
they'll get four this ball. Short, angling into Pollard, rising fairly steeply and cramping him. He swivels quickly, though, and pulls fine - fine leg is too square to be able to cut it off
back of a length on middle and off, punched to long-on

gone! Or is it? How did it carry that far off the thigh pad? Shortish ball at the body, looks to pull, and it lobs up to the fielder at short fine leg. Not much of an appeal from KKR, and yeah, it's off the thigh pad

goes deep in his crease to manufacture length, get under this full ball. Can't get under enough to get the elevation he'd like with that hit - which is good for him, because his shot isn't timed all that well and it bounces well short of long-on.
back of a length outside off. Looks to make room and carve over the covers, misses
back of a length, pitching outside leg and turning towards leg stump. Rana flicks to deep midwicket
down the track, gets to the pitch of this flighted ball and drives to long-on

tossed up on middle and off, looks for the big sweep, drags it squarer than he'd like and Woakes running in from deep square leg and diving forward, can't get close to it. It bounces a couple of feet from him and hits him on the chest

down the track again, doesn't get close to this offbreak. Flicks hard at it, and it rolls down to short fine leg and nearly undoes the fielder with sharp turn off the outfield. Was spinning away to Suryakumar's left and he did well to stop it
down the track again, gets close to the pitch and clips to deep midwicket
ends his spell with a dot ball. Offbreak, tossed up slower. Rana goes for the slog-sweep and misses, and the ball doesn't miss off stump by much

big wicket, and is that the match? Wide short ball from Woakes, banged in to get some bounce on it. He has third man back, and Pollard goes for the cut and ends up slicing underneath, up in the air and straight to the fielder
down the track, making some room. Woakes bangs it short again, angling across the left-hander. Looks to slap over cover, ends up slicing on the bounce to third man
short, a bit of width. Has to jump to get on top of the bounce, chops it to the left of cover
shot. Manufactures the length with a big step back, deep into his crease. Shortens Woakes' length, clears his front leg, and flat-bats over cover

missed run-out. Again that step back, and Woakes retaliates with a slower ball, fuller. Slaps it to mid-off, and has to run a greater distance because of that back-foot step. The throw to Woakes is on the bounce, and he fumbles it. Ends up breaking the stumps with just his hands, with Rana well short of his crease. Did well to rush back to the stumps, though, Woakes.
short, wide, and this time Hardik puts it away with a rasping square-cut. Just bullets to the point boundary
full-toss, thigh-high, angling down leg. Looks to swat it away and only manages to get thigh pad on it
slower ball, back of a length on the stumps. Looks to pull and only manages to squeeze it away through backward square leg off the inside half of the bat
low full-toss wide of off stump, and he's found the gap very well. Just angles his bat face to thread it to the left of backward point and the right of third man
another full-toss, on the pads this time, and Rana has just flicked that for six over backward square leg! Super timing on that
slower length ball outside off, slogged away, along the ground, to deep midwicket
what a six-hitter this man is. Short, angling into the body, and he simply clears his front leg and clears the wide long-on boundary with a flat pull. Wow

another six! This time it's Rana. Full-toss on the stumps and he shuffles across to the off side, exposes his stumps, and scoops the ball fine, to the right of the keeper, and gets it to carry all the way
another full-toss. Are KKR struggling with dew? Similar line and a little higher than the previous ball, and this time he moves leg-side of the ball and scoops it over mid-off to bring up his fifty
gets the yorker right, but his line is wrong, a fair way down the leg side.
he goes full, on the stumps, and he gets his man. Looks to make room, Rana, and slices it to point. Hits it well, too well, straight into Narine's hands at shoulder height
yorker on off stump, and that's the shot Harbhajan played to win the Chennai Test in 2001. Jams down with an open face to dab it behind point. He got a two then, only a single this time
another full-toss, angling into the stumps, and Hardik has clobbered it. Clears his front leg again, and swings it away, cleanly, over the midwicket boundary
slower length ball on middle and leg, the legcutter. Plays with a straight bat, pushes to long-on to retain strike
full, down the leg side. Looks to swipe it away through square leg, only gets pad on it, rolls down towards fine leg and they scamper two

full-toss again, and Suryakumar has fumbled on the long-on boundary! The simplest of stops, and it slips through his fingers and rolls over the rope. Extra pace meant Hardik couldn't get the elevation he wanted on this, just hit it hard along the ground to long-on
bouncer, that's a very accurate bouncer at a pressure moment - rising towards Hardik's head. He does well to sway out of the way

dropped! Another bouncer, Hardik has to fetch this pull from over his right shoulder, ends up top-edging. Rishi Dhawan, the deep square leg fielder, runs in, stops, slips momentarily on the dewy turf, and has to dive to complete the catch but can't get near it
a four to win it! back of a length, at the hip, and fine leg was to square to stop this. Does well to swat it away really fine, and a despairing dive from Rajpoot can't stop Mumbai from winning this
